summary: Based on the provided documents, there is no information available about Courtney Evans. The documents primarily concern the FBI's response to requests from the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) for materials related to Martin Luther King, Jr., and the Southern Christian Leadership Conference (SCLC), as well as investigations into FBI interactions with the CIA and concerns about mail opening activities and COINTELPRO. One document mentions Chicago mobster Sam Giancana's plans to influence Attorney General Robert Kennedy. The documents do not provide any details about Courtney Evans or their involvement in any of the mentioned activities.
significance: Based on the provided documents, the significance of Courtney Evans in the JFK context is not apparent, as the documents do not mention this person.
